noun.description: A person's natural tendency or urge to act or feel in a particular way; a disposition or propensity.
examples: John was a scientist by training and inclination
he was free to follow his inclinations
changes in inclination of the line on the graph

noun.description: The angle at which a straight line or plane is inclined to another.

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin inclinatio(n-), from inclinare bend towards (see incline).
